intro: Stachys gossweileri, commonly known as the Sierra grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the mint family (Lamiaceae) and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high elevations. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, and it has slender, hairy stems. Stachys gossweileri is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
